intro: Cacalia viscosa, commonly known as stickyweed or hairy bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers are typically blue to purple in color. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open areas such as meadows and slopes. Cacalia viscosa is an herbaceous perennial that produces small, showy blooms throughout the summer.
